intro: Triglochin floridana, commonly known as Florida arrowgrass, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Florida. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and typically grows in marshy or swampy areas. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in spikelets. It thrives in saturated soils and is often found in coastal regions. Triglochin floridana plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
